resources.string: Do you want to continue to the next task?
Please draw a line, going from a number to a letter in ascending order. Begin from (1) and then to A then to 2 and so on. The last one is E
Copy this drawing as accurately as you can, in the space below
Draw a clock. Put in all the numbers and set the time to %1$s.

"Tell me as many words as you can think of that begin with %1$s. You can say any kind of word you want, except for proper nouns (like Bob or Boston), numbers, or words that begin with the same sound but have a different suffix, for example, love, lover, loving. I will tell you to stop after one minute "
Now I am going to say some more numbers, but when I am through you must repeat them to me in the backwards order.

I am going to read a list of words that you will have to remember now and later on. Tell me as many words as you can remember. It doesn’t matter in what order you say them. I am going to read the same list for a second time. Try to remember and tell me as many words as you can, including words you said the first time. I will ask you to recall those words again at the end of the test.
I am going to say some numbers and when I am through, type them to me exactly as I said them
I am going to read a sequence of letters. Every time I say the letter %1$s, tap your hand once. If I say a different letter, do not tap.
Now, I will ask you to count by subtracting %1$d from %2$d, and then, keep subtracting %1$d from your answer until I tell you to stop
I am going to read you a sentence. Repeat it after me, exactly as I say it.
I am going to give you two words and I want you to introduce the similarity of them.
I read some words to you earlier, which I asked you to remember. Tell me as many of those words as you can remember
I am going to ask you some question about the date and place you are now.
Can you tell me the name of this animal?
This is your first time using the app, do you want to see the tutorial?
Welcome to the tutorial. \nYou are going to see how to use the tasks provided for you.
The tasks have 3 areas: top (blue), center (red) and bottom (green). The top one contains useful information about what needs to be done.
The center contains the playable area where you will be able to complete the task.

The bottom contains buttons to undo certain actions, to provide more information about the task and to continue to the next task. If you do not know how to complete the task you can skip it with the next button, located on the right. To finish the tutorial click on the next button.
Cognimobile allows you to get all the data needed for your studies plus context data from your patients in order you to diagnose better.
Your study patients have the possibility to do several tests on their own.
All the data collected from the studies will be secure on your server, thanks to the AWARE framework.
You have not any undo times left.
Task is ended. Press Next to continue.
Could not get the study link
Provide the study link in the space below.
There is not any study active at the moment. Please click the button bellow and add one
There are not any tests available at the moment.

Cognimobile is a part of Cognimobile Platform, an End-Of-Degree project developed by Guillermo Bueno Vargas at the University of Granada. The aim of this project is to ease the compilation of contextual information from patients and make possible to administer cognitive test digitally.
You have completed the test. Well done!
